macro.abstract: The macro appends its second argument to its first argument.

usage.param: The to which g2 is to be appended.

macro.para: This macro appends the elements contained in g2 to the tail of g1, resulting in a of the same type as g1.

The running time of can be described in terms of the number of required to complete the algorithm. The asymptotic upper bound of O(n+m+2), where n is the number of elements in g1 and m is the number of elements in g2, occurs when the type of g2 differs from the type of g1. The asymptotic lower bound of Ω(n+1) occurs when g1 and g2 share the same type.

The efficiency of the algorithm's use of the can be described in terms of the total depth of required to complete the algorithm. The asymptotic upper bound of O(max(n,m)+1) occurs when the type of g2 differs from the type of g1. The asymptotic lower bound of Ω(n+1) occurs when g1 and g2 share the same type.
